title: Sum of Reciprocals of Triangular Numbers
description: The sum of reciprocals of triangular numbers equals 2: ∑(2/(n(n+1))) = 2. A beautiful telescoping series result.

overview.historicalContext: Triangular numbers were studied by the Pythagoreans. This identity connects them to infinite series via partial fractions.
overview.problemStatement:
**Sum of Triangular Reciprocals**:

$$\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{T_n} = \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{2}{n(n+1)} = 2$$

where $T_n = n(n+1)/2$ is the nth triangular number.
overview.proofStrategy: Use partial fractions: 2/(n(n+1)) = 2(1/n - 1/(n+1)). The series telescopes to 2·1 = 2.

conclusion.summary: The telescoping series identity is verified using Mathlib's infinite sum machinery.
